poem:
### Recklessness

Maps marked with embers,  
lines traced in ash —  
the blind dance of spies beneath winter's grey eyelid.  
Secrets whisper like smoke in narrow streets,  
where shadows plot in the language of ghosts.  
Each spark a careless signal,  
morse-code of the reckless,  
flaring into silence  
as nations exhale.  
Flint strikes flint,  
and history waits.

What has particularly alarmed western spy bosses is the sheer recklessness". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long.
